evidence_span: Differences between out-of-flux oxide thickness near the inlet and outlet ends of the tubes were small (compared to differences between in-flux and out-of-flux values) but significant.

evidence_span: Oxide growth rates at the out-of-flux positions are shown in Fig. 4 in comparison to the Hillner correlation for out-reactor oxidation.

evidence_span: There is good agreement with Hillner's prediction at the inlet and outlet temperatures.

source_id: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_045_chunk7
evidence_span: Yes, there is a very significant flux effect different from the temperature effect.

evidence_span: Factors of 20 to 60 enhancement attributed to flux were seen at given temperatures.
